other_tests.findings: A single large gallstone is seen within the gallbladder. The gallbladder wall is not thickened, and no pericholecystic fluid is present. The common bile duct measures 7 mm. No filling defects are seen within the common hepatic duct, bile duct or pancreatic duct. No strictures are seen of the common bile duct or pancreatic duct. There is no intrahepatic bile duct dilatation. The liver demonstrates diffuse fatty infiltration, with evidence of signal dropout on out of phase imaging. No focal liver lesions are identified. The spleen, both kidneys, both adrenal glands, and the pancreas are normal in signal intensity with no focal abnormalities. In particular, the pancreas enhances homogenously with no evidence of necrosis. No peripancreatic fluid is seen. No evidence of pancreatic edema. No significant adenopathy is present. Intra-abdominal adenopathy is present. The portal vein, splenic vein, and superior mesenteric vein are widely patent. The celiac artery and superior mesenteric artery are widely patent also. A splenule is identified in the right upper quadrant.
